text: Hey Ian I would love to reuse this code and do something similar with popular topics on the posts (sourcing them from all 5 blogs and displaying them in a list), I have gotten it to where I can get some topics to show up (not 100% sure they are coming from all of the blogs though) but I am struggling to get a URL that will display the posts, as some of the topics are used in multiple blogs. do you have any thoughts on this? I really appreciate your time! I am mainly a HTML CSS coder so this is a bit outside of my normal element but a fun challenge :smile:
You'd probably need to add a query string to the page: `?topic=foo`. Then you can pull the topic into the HubL with `request.query_dict.topic`
If I'm understanding what you're trying to do correctly
I think you want `<a class="topic-link" href="{{ blog_tag_url('default', topic.slug) }}">{{ topic.name }}</a>`
I don't think you want the `{% if pop_tag.topic_list %}`
hmm I took out the pop_tag.topic_list, but the blog_tag_url is still pulling in the wrong domain
Well it's gonna be whatever domain your default blog is on

If you want to link to a page that pulls from all blogs, you might want to do the query string thing I suggested, along with something like `<a class="topic-link" href="https://path.to/page?topic={{ topic.slug }}">{{ topic.name }}</a>`
